description: Are you ready to get ready? You may be but your web component surely isn't! Did you know there's a hook for you to execute code when the component is fully loaded?
The "ready" function, which isn't static, allows you to add JavaScript code after your component is, well, ready. Ain't that convenient?
The ready function is already defined in Polymer.Element class. So you will be overriding the function. In JavaScript, this means you need to add super.ready() as the first call of the function.

Give it a try! Add a ready method, call the one from super and then set "_readyToFire" to true. Note that _readyToFire is a property and should be accessed via "this"! Put it below your static methods! Good luck.
followUpMessage: Hooray, we are ready to fire! So let's do just that!

exercises.template:
<link rel="import" href="lib/polymer/polymer-element.html">
<link rel="import" href="leather-pouch.html">
<link rel="import" href="rubber-strip.html">
<link rel="import" href="handle.html">
<link rel="import" href="rock.html">

<dom-module id="slingshot">
    <template>
        <rock></rock>
        <leather-pouch></leather-pouch>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_leftSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_rightSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <handle></handle>
    </template>
</dom-module>

<script>
    class Slingshot extends Polymer.Element {

        static get is() {
            return 'slingshot';
        }

        static get properties() {
            return {
                _leftSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Left',
                },
                _rightSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Right',
                },
                _readyToFire: {
                    type: Boolean,
                    value: false,
                },
            };
        }
    }

    window.customElements.define(Slingshot.is, Slingshot);
</script>
exercises.hint:
<link rel="import" href="lib/polymer/polymer-element.html">
<link rel="import" href="leather-pouch.html">
<link rel="import" href="rubber-strip.html">
<link rel="import" href="handle.html">
<link rel="import" href="rock.html">

<dom-module id="slingshot">
    <template>
        <rock></rock>
        <leather-pouch></leather-pouch>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_leftSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_rightSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <handle></handle>
    </template>
</dom-module>

<script>
    class Slingshot extends Polymer.Element {

        static get is() {
            return 'slingshot';
        }

        static get properties() {
            return {
                _leftSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Left',
                },
                _rightSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Right',
                },
                _readyToFire: {
                    type: Boolean,
                    value: false,
                },
            };
        }

        ready() {
            super.ready();

            this._readyToFire = true;
        }
    }

    window.customElements.define(Slingshot.is, Slingshot);
</script>
